CatDescriptText: George Christian, elevator operator, 528 Grace Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "I figure that if it is absolutely necessary for both parents to work then they should make good provisions for the care of the children.  One thing would be to make certain that the children of an older age belong to a good club.  As for the younger children they should have a good baby sitter [sic].  But regardless of what good arrangements you make for the children, there still will be a bad effect."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Christian wearing plaid cap, moustache, patterned scarf, and light colored zipper coat with plush collar, standing in front of stone building with store windows on either side, one on left with clock that reads 2:25, and one on right with sign that reads "Sale Top Coats..."
